Message:
I still remember
my first performance.
I was so nervous and worked up,
worrying about what’d happen
if I messed up.

But then, the ringmaster
and my troupemates
reassured me that I could do it.
They taught me the most
important thing to focus on.

“It’s okay, Flack.
Don’t you worry
about messing up.

What matters is how
you make the most of it.”

If someone focuses too much
on doing things perfectly,

just for their smile to be
sacrificed in the end,
it’d be such a waste.

What’s important isn’t
pulling stuff off flawlessly,
but having tons of fun on stage,
where everyone’s the star!

“So let’s see that smile, Flack.
And have fun out there!”

A circus isn’t something
that can be pulled off alone.
If even one person is missing,
it just won’t work.

“We’ll put on the best show
only we can provide,

and make those crowds out there
smile ’til their cheeks hurt!

I know we can do it
together, Flack!”

“And if the going gets tough,
you’ve got Ringmaster Cordie
right here by your side!

I ended with a wink,
and Flack finally smiled,
looking more reassured.

“Yes, ma’am!
I’ll follow ya to the ends
of the world, Great Cordie!”

Aw, jeez... Right now,
I’m the Ringmaster, remember?
Well, as long as she’s smiling,
I don’t really mind.
